alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Union; Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 5:23PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Bradford, south central Baker, northeastern Union and west central Clay Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 522 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Butler to near Keystone Heights. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Starke, Keystone Heights, Raiford, Kingsley, Lawtey, Hampton, Ellerbee and Johnstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
